Package om.equation

Code for converting a small subset of LaTeX format to XML and then for displaying equations in the XML format (either as bitmaps or converting to XML).

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
SuperSubHolder.EatsOwnSuperSub Interface items (appearing in 'main' slot) should implement if they eat their own super and sub items and don't want a SuperSubHolder to render them.
 

Class Summary
Bold Doesn't do anything in itself, but helps to display the child text items in bold style.
Brackets Puts stretchy (height-matching) brackets around a child item
ContourIntegral Displays Contour Integral sign.
Equation Includes static utility methods to convert equations.
Fraction Arranges two child Items one above the other with a line between, centred
Hat Puts a wide hat(circumflex) on top of child item.
Integral Displays sum using sigma notation
LimitsThing Something that shows limits using super/subscript.
Line Arranges child Items into a horizontal line
MBox Doesn't do anything in itself, but ensures that text boxes format like normal text instead of like an equation e.g.
Placeholder Blank area that informs equation of its position within the target image.
SimpleNode Represents parts of equations that are just bits of text.
SquareRoot Puts a square root around single child Item
Sum Displays sum using sigma notation
SuperSub Just holds an item, reducing its text size
SuperSubHolder Arranges (up to) two child items above/below a parent
Test Class for testing the equation compontent.
TestListFontsWithChar This test program lists all the fonts that contain a certain character.
TestSymbols Class for testing the equation compontent.
Text Simple mathematical text item
TextEquation Interprets simple equations into XHTML
TextSizeChange Changes text size in force from this point in the equation onward.
 

Exception Summary
EquationFormatException Error in format of equation XML
 

Package om.equation Description

Code for converting a small subset of LaTeX format to XML and then for displaying equations in the XML format (either as bitmaps or converting to XML). This code provides the underlying behaviour of the <equation> and <eq> question components, but could be used in other situations too.

Begin with static methods in the Equation class for most uses.

The '.generated' package is created by the Ant build script using JavaCC and JJTree utilities, based on the grammar specification grammar.jjt. Don't mess with anything in there.

Covered in document: Om question authoring.doc
